<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 15"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Craft Anything](/Feats.aspx?ID=773) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 260 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Legendary in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)

</column>

---

You can find ways to craft just about anything, despite restrictions. As long as you have the appropriate Crafting skill feat (such as [Magical Crafting](/Feats.aspx?ID=812) for magic items) and meet the item’s level and proficiency requirement, you ignore just about any other requirement, such as being of a specific ancestry or providing spells. The only exceptions are requirements that add to the item’s cost, including castings of spells that themselves have a cost, and requirements of special items such as the _philosopher’s stone_ that have exclusive means of access and Crafting. The GM decides whether you can ignore a requirement.
name: Craft Anything
